page.title: 01KERSEY-HADLEIGH
page.content: In our study area the dominant land cover is agricultural crops, mainly wheat, barley and oil seed rape. The settlement of this area is mainly isolated farmsteads but there is also part of the village of Kersey and part of the town of Hadleigh. Kersey is now a small village that is well known for the tudor timber buildings and a ford in the main street. Hadleigh is a small Suffolk market town that has become a dormatory town for Ipswich.The tip of Hadleigh in the study area is mainly the new industrial estate, housing many light industries. This area was once heavily populated and the local economy was based on wool. After many centuries of decline the area is once again growing, this time it is the proximity to Europe that has provided the energy to grow. ***************************************
